page.title: 01Haconby, The edge of the Fen
page.content: The low hills in the west flatter out into the true Lincolnshire Fens - from 100 feet eleration at Stainfield down to Haconby which is about 15 feet above the sea. Further east the Fenland continues to the Wash. The land is fertile and intensivly farmed. Little natural ground cover exists in the east of the block as few hedgerows and trees remain. although farming is the major industry and the villages remain essentially local communities, there is a growing number of small business in such fields as designn, computers and plumbing, and more people are travelling to work outside the area. Morton in undergoing change as new private housing continues to be built. The west part of the block is mainly woods, pasture and low hills which provide a good habitat for wildlife.
